name: Mechanist
description: Tinkers who have specialized in advanced mechanical systems and automated constructs, creating complex machines that can operate independently and perform sophisticated tasks beyond the capabilities of simple gadgets.

Some constructs require maintaining focus, consuming energy over time

Depleted energy causes penalties to construct effectiveness and operation

lore: Mechanists represent tinkers who have transcended basic invention to master the creation and control of complex mechanical systems and autonomous constructs. Where ordinary tinkers might focus on individual gadgets or simple devices, Mechanists develop integrated systems of machines that can work together to accomplish sophisticated tasks with minimal direct oversight. The path to becoming a Mechanist often involves years of study and experimentation with increasingly complex mechanical designs, culminating in the creation of truly autonomous constructs that can operate independently. Those who succeed find themselves capable of building mechanical assistants and systems that dramatically extend their capabilities, allowing them to solve problems and overcome challenges that would be impossible for a single individual. Mechanists serve various roles in society, from developing industrial automation systems that increase productivity to creating specialized constructs for dangerous environments where humans cannot safely operate. Some focus on practical applications of their technology, while others push the boundaries of what's possible through experimental designs and theoretical innovation. Their ability to create machines tailored to specific needs makes them invaluable in complex operations where standard tools and approaches would be insufficient. Though they may lack the raw power of warriors or the magical versatility of spellcasters, the mechanical ingenuity and adaptive problem-solving of Mechanists allow them to develop unique solutions to almost any challenge they encounter.
